Journal.Title: Environmental science and pollution research international

Article.ArticleTitle: Catalytic ozone oxidation toluene over supported manganese cobalt composite: influence of catalyst support.

AbstractText: In this study, the manganese cobalt composite (Mn-Co)-loaded SiO<sub>2</sub>, MgO, TiO<sub>2</sub>, γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> and silicalite-1 were prepared by ultrasonic complexation method. The catalysts were characterized by XRD, BET, SEM, TEM, H<sub>2</sub>-TPR and XPS, and the activity of catalytic oxidation of toluene was evaluated. It was found that Mn-Co loaded γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> (Mn<sub>2</sub>CoO<sub>x</sub>/γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>) exhibited excellent catalytic activity. When the gas hour space velocity (GHSV) was 45,000 h<sup>-1</sup>, the removal rate of toluene reached 91.2% within 5.5 h, and the selectivity of CO<sub>2</sub> was 71.10% at ambient temperature. The operation of Mn<sub>2</sub>CoO<sub>x</sub>/γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> at different temperatures was investigated, and the better toluene removal efficiency more than 80% after reacting 9h was obtained at 50 °C. The characterization results showed that better catalytic activity is related to smaller grain size, higher Mn<sup>3+</sup>/Mn<sup>4+</sup> values and the relative content of active oxygen species (O<sub>II</sub> + O<sub>III</sub>). Increased amounts of low state species easily led to the imbalance of the catalyst surface charge and promoted the formation of more oxygen vacancies.
